intro: Jocaste, commonly known as the Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes azaleas and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, often blooming in spring and summer. Its foliage consists of dense, dark green leaves that provide year-round visual interest. Jocaste is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens due to its compact size and attractive blooms.
